intro: Cereus haageanus, commonly known as the night bloomer or ghost flower, is a cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and its ability to bloom at night. The plant produces large, white, fragrant flowers that open in the evening. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its striking appearance and nocturnal blooming habit, it is a popular choice for gardeners and botanists alike.
